title: China launches 14 satellites with new solid rocket from mobile sea platform
summary: China launched its new Jielong-3 rocket from a mobile sea platform in the Yellow Sea Friday, successfully sending 14 satellites into orbit.

title: SpaceX requests permission for direct-to-smartphone service
summary: SpaceX could provide “full and continuous” direct-to-smartphone services across much of the globe with less than a third of the 7,500 Gen 2 Starlink satellites approved last week, the company said in a request to add the capability to the broadband constellation.

title: Michigan Students to Hear from Current NASA Space Station Astronaut
summary: Students in Charlevoix, Michigan, will have an opportunity next week to hear from a NASA astronaut living and working aboard the International Space Station.

title: Dawn Aerospace raises $20 million for propulsion and spaceplane work
summary: Dawn Aerospace has raised $20 million to expand its line of in-space propulsion products and continue spaceplane development.

title: SES government unit rebranded as SES Space & Defense
summary: The U.S.-based subsidiary of satellite operator SES has been renamed to reflect the company’s focus on the national security market.

title: NASA Selects Eastern Region Protective Services Contractor
summary: NASA has selected Chenega Global Protection, LLC. of Chantilly, Virginia, to receive the NASA Protective Services – Eastern Region contract. The

title: Collins Aerospace selected to develop new space station spacesuit
summary: NASA has selected Collins Aerospace to develop a next-generation spacesuit for the International Space Station, replacing aging suits that have become a safety concern.

title: NASA Taps Collins Aerospace to Develop New Space Station Spacesuits
summary: NASA has awarded a task order to Collins Aerospace to deliver a spacewalking system for potential use outside the International Space Station.

title: Terran Orbital creates new business unit to produce imaging satellites
summary: Satellite manufacturer Terran Orbital has formed a new business unit that will produce electro-optical imaging satellites.

title: SpaceX launches first of three missions for OneWeb
summary: SpaceX conducted its 55th flight of the year to take the OneWeb Flight #15 mission using a flight-proven Falcon 9 to a polar low Earth orbit (LEO) from Launch Complex 39A (LC-39A) at the Kennedy Space Center (KSC) in Florida. Liftoff occurred on Dec. 8 at 5:27:48 PM EST (22:27:48 UTC).
